title: Why should I major in food science? - Quora

response.answer_text: What are the most important things in life? Let's constrain this question to material aspects of life. And look at it from a population perspective rather that the individual's. At least that's what I did when deciding to pursue a PhD in the area.  The first thing would be the air that we breathe. Without it we wouldn't last more than a couple of minutes.  The second thing would be water. Without it we're talking not more than a few days really.  The third is food. Not medicine. Not IT. Food. Pretty cool, right?! There's also a million relevant ethical considerations in re production systems, sustainability, health, animal welfare, wealth distribution, feeding a growing population, planetary boundaries and what not. Plus food will give you some of the most intense pleasures in itself. Just imagine what it'll do when you know the whats, the whys and the hows... Considering the challenges ahead of us, it's also a chance to be part of a solution. But like most career options, something to consider and follow only if you think it'll yank you chain. It did mine and I am very happy for my choice.

If you enjoy the sciences and want a profession where science and technology can be used-Food Science is a great choice as a college major. Additionally, people will always have to eat so there is an ongoing demand for those with this type of training! Within this area of study are various areas in whic to focus. If you are creative and have a love of all things culinary, food product development is a great choice. If you have a strong interest in making safe food, then the quality assurance and food safety aspects of the food industry may appeal to you. If you like the mechanical an process side of the food industry, consider a focus in food engineering or food production. The food industry will always exist to provide food to feed the world….providing a steady source of employment to those who major in Food Science!
